thread.title: Theresa May meets New Zealand’s new PM in Downing Street for post-Brexit trade talks
thread.title_full: Theresa May meets New Zealand’s new PM in Downing Street for post-Brexit trade talks

title: Theresa May meets New Zealand’s new PM in Downing Street for post-Brexit trade talks
text:
Earlier this week, the New Zealand prime minister met with European Commission president Jean-Claude Juncker in Brussels ahead of the possible opening of free trade negotiations with the bloc. 
He was also due to meet German chancellor Angela Merkel as part of his first overseas trip. Britain and New Zealand have agreed to set up regular trade policy talks 
But Mr English, who took office last month following the resignation of his party leader John Key, faced warnings from rival politicians the EU’s huge farming lobby would mean a deal “isn’t going to go very far, very fast”. 
Instead, the new prime minister was told by the populist New Zealand First party to make a UK trade deal a “priority” over an EU agreement. 
Last year, International Trade Secretary Liam Fox revealed Britain and New Zealand had agreed to set up regular trade policy talks as the Government carries out Britain’s exit from the EU. 
The UK cannot formally agree any trade deals until Brexit is complete but Dr Fox’s department has been courting a number of non-EU countries around the world as it scopes out possible post-Brexit agreements. 
Mrs May today celebrated six months as Prime Minister. Related articles
